songs.title: Skengman

description.plain:
Ghetts links up with Stormzy again for a dark grime track produced by his frequent collaborator Ten Billion Dreams. With his familiar aggressive flow, he and Stormz rap about their gang lives and street violence—not unusual topics for Ghetts.

The Stormzy feature is particularly significant considering his famous nicknames of Mr Skeng and Wicked Skengman, identities built around the word “skeng” or “skengman.” A widely used British slang term, they mean a gun, knife or someone who carries them.

songs.title: IC3

description.plain: Ghetts and Skepta reflect on their experiences as Black men and musical pioneers over this track named after the UK police designation for Black people. The two legends have never made a song together but have appeared on several sets together, and even clashed at times.

songs.embed_content: Read “IC3” by Ghetts on Genius

songs.title: Esco’s Spirit

description.plain:
Taken from the 2014 sequel to 2011’s Momentum, “Esco’s Spirit” is a tribute to the late grime MC Esco (also known as Escobar).

This beat is Rynsa Man’s bootleg remix of Jahlil Beats “Jackpot” (popularised by Bobby Shmurda’s vocal version “Hot Nigga”). Rynsa Man has made the beat slightly slower and at a lower pitch. MCs looking to vocal it can buy a copy of the remix here.



Ghetts cleverly uses interpolations of Esco lyrics with his own twists.

songs.full_title: Daily Duppy by Ghetts (Ft. GRM Daily)
songs.title: Daily Duppy

description.plain:
“Daily Duppy” marks Ghetts' return to rap platform GRM Daily’s synonymous series of the same name, following his previous appearance in 2016. It signifies the start of GRM Daily’s “#5MilliSubs” series, as they celebrate reaching 5 million subscribers on their YouTube channel.

The dark instrumental of the track mirrors the MC’s lyrical content. Ghetts warns opponents away by describing acts of violence, alongside demonstrating his typically intricate wordplay.

The track was initially teased on Ghetts and GRM Daily’s Instagram accounts, just hours before its release. The accompanying video premiered at 7pm on March 28, 2022, alongside being released on other streaming platforms.

description.plain:
After the original “YouDunKnow Already” where Ghetts sampled So Solid Crew’s “Oh No (Sentimental Things),” a similar song was released by Scrufizzer, with a music video seemingly filmed in the same location.

In response to this, Ghetts released this remix with So Solid Crew member Megaman and three other current grime MCs, while throwing a few disses towards Scrufizzer.

songs.title: Grime Daily

description.plain:
Track number 6 of the calm before the storm.

In it Ghetts is stating his love and dedication to grime even if he might occasionally venture to other genre’s or make chart topper’s.
